0P0000PUY1.F.summary: The Fund aims to maximise risk-adjusted returns by investing in emerging markets government and corporate bonds. It is a total return, non-benchmarked fund with a strong capital preservation emphasis. The Fundâs use of dynamic risk budgeting and active allocation processes to sub-asset classes in both local and hard currency emerging markets debt should allow the fund the flexibility to create alpha across different market conditions.
0P0000PUY1.F.manager_bio:
Daniel manages the ACPI Emerging Markets Fixed Income UCITS Fund. He has a broad experience in Global EM Debt with a strong focus on Currencies, Local Markets and Frontier Markets. Daniel has been managing portfolios in both Long and Absolute return EM related products for more than 15 years.

Prior to joining ACPI, Daniel was founder and Managing Partner at EM Quest Capital, a dedicated Emerging Market Fixed Income specialist boutique with assets under advisory of over $3.5bn. Daniel was a senior member of Sydbank's emerging markets portfolio management and investment strategy group. He has held various positions as senior portfolio manager at Global Evolution in Denmark, Union Investment and DWS Investment in Frankfurt and started his career as a fixed income and currency research analyst at Dresdner Kleinwort Benson in Frankfurt and London. He holds a European Master in Management from the EAP-ESCP (Paris-Oxford-Berlin) and a BA in Business Administration from ESIC University in Madrid. Daniel attended an executive education program at INSEAD in 1998. Daniel has investment industry experience since 1997.

0P00016XRL.BE.summary: The Global Bond Fundâs investment objective is to provide income and capital growth by investing primarily in transferable debt instruments denominated in a variety of currencies which include but are not limited to, municipal and government bonds, agency debt (being that issued by local authorities or public international bodies of which one or more governments is a member), mortgage related debt and corporate debt, that are listed, traded or dealt in on a Regulated Market in the OECD and which may have fixed or floating interest rates. 0P0001K8IB.SW.summary: The Investment Manager seeks to meet its objective through the careful selection of debt securities issued primarily by US corporate borrowers that, at the time of purchase, have a Moody's or equivalent rating of at least B3, but typically less than A.
0P0001K8IB.SW.manager_bio: Mr. Comeaux, Portfolio Manager, joined the Muzinich & Co., Inc in 2006. Prior to joining Muzinich, Clint was a research analyst for the high yield and private equity funds at WR Huff Asset Management. Previously, Clint was a Manager at Enron responsible for physical trading in the forest products sector. Clint is also a Chemical Engineer, formerly with PPG Industries. He holds a B.S. in Chemical Engineering, Summa Cum Laude, from Tulane University as well as an M.B.A. from the Leonard N. Stern School of Business at New York University.

HHIF.AS.summary: The fund invests in Dutch securities and international securities that are expected to generate a relatively high return. The objective of its policy is dispersion in different types of securities. With this variety the fund strives for a moderation of the investment risk. There may be invested in bonds, real estate funds, preferred stocks, convertibles, stocks and primary and secondary structured products. In addition the fund may write secured call options. In each of the above mentioned categories the investment is limited to 25% of the fund capital with the exception of the bonds category. Within this category a balanced dispersion in sectors is the goal. Maximum 5% of the fund capital may be invested in a single body with the exception of governments with an AAA rating. The fund may invest up to 120% of the fund capital. The funds' currency is the Euro. Positions in foreign currency will be hedged for at least 95%.

HHPF.AS.summary: The objective of the fund is the realization of capital growth for an intermediate period or longer by investing in non liquid securities and high return debt. With non liquid securities the fund means those securities which are not heavily traded because the information published is few and the market therefore puts them in a high risk profile. With high return dept the fund means bonds and convertibles of issuing bodies like bank loans and trade requisitioning on enterprises for which the market believes they have a high risk profile. The fund is co managed by Faxtor Securities B.V.
